title: Victor Wanyama insists Tottenham CAN recover from early-season slump
text:
Victor Wanyama is convinced Tottenham will arrest their poor start to the season and can get back to their best - starting against Watford this weekend.

Mauricio Pochettino's side have endured a miserable start to 2019-20 and went into the international break on the back of a 7-2 defeat to Bayern Munich in the Champions League and a 3-0 league loss at Brighton.

Having finished in the top four last season and reached the Champions League final, expectations were high heading into the new campaign, only for Tottenham to under-perform so far.

Victor Wanyama is confident that Tottenham can turn around their poor start to the season

Mauricio Pochettino's side are ninth in the Premier League following a poor run of results

Pochettino's side are sat slumped ninth in the table following three wins, two draws and three defeats.

But Wanyama, speaking to Nairobi News in Kenya after playing 90 minutes in a friendly defeat to Mozambique this week, is confident the bad form is nothing more than a momentary blip.

'We [Tottenham] are facing tough times and my focus is fully helping the team overcome that,' Wanyama said.

Wanyama has been limited this season and had had to accept a role coming off the bench

'We are working very hard and shall be back to our best.'

Wanyama has fallen down the pecking order at Spurs and looked set for a summer exit from north London with Belgian side Club Brugge interested.

But while he has struggled for matches this season, Wanyama is not looking to exit, rather fight for his place and re-establish himself as a primary option.

'Of course I was unsettled with the transfer news because it was coming in the news every day,' Wanyama told Goal.

'What happened in the transfer window is passed me now and my main focus is to train as hard as I can to make sure I regain my position in the team.

'I don't think it is difficult to win my position back, I just need to push myself even harder and keep working hard in training to achieve the same and I know it will happen soon.'
description: Having finished in the top four last season and reached the Champions League final, expectations were high heading into the new campaign, only for Tottenham to under-perform so far.
